about.01: CROWD4EMS is an innovative European Service Platform  providing unique EU access point to filtered social media and crowdsourced data , to support emergency responders in collecting coordinated and structured Volunteer Geographic Information (VGI) input from their qualified crowd of volunteers as well as, directly from citizens in a working and validated operational framework.

home.cookies: We use cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to visit this site you agree to our use of cookies.

translation.title: Help translating disaster related words
translation.subtitle: We’ll use this translation to get content in Social Media. We are tring to identify slang and local language.

relevanceTags.info: Choose as many tags as you want

account.completeMsg: Please, provide from which group or team are you joining this site.
account.deleteMsg: Are you sure you want to delete your account? This action cannot be undone.
account.getData: You will get an email when the data is available
account.name: Name

index.fund: The E2mC Project is co-funded by the European commission / H2020 Programme Grant Agreement No. 730082
index.subtitle1: When a natural disaster happens, emergency responders need high-quality information quickly to make good decisions.
index.subtitle2: Social media is a potential source of such data. However, the information is not always reliable.
index.subtitle3: With your help, we can improve the reliability of data coming from social media.
index.explanation1: Social media is a potential source of data in case of natural disasters, however the information is not always reliable.
index.explanation4: Help us check and improve the data coming from social media to  provide high-quality data quickly to first responders.
index.explanation6: Learn new skills by using geospatial information systems (GIS) to accurately map social data to the area affected by a natural disaster.
index.explanation10: We have just a few hours to deliver
index.subtitleJoin: A few minutes of your time will help us to respond more efficiently in crisis and disasters.

twitter.river: Sea waves or just sea shore, floode river, etc
twitter.politics: Politicians and/or politicians discussing about the event
twitter.map: Maps showing the eye of hurricane
twitter.roads: Images showing the impact of the disaster (flooded roads/streets/buildings)
twitter.clues: Images showingvisual cues or with information about the location
twitter.tags: Tag this image with the following options
twitter.tagsVideo: Tag this video with the following options
twitter.useful: Is this image providing useful information about the
twitter.usefulVideo: Is this video providing useful information about the
twitter.modalTitle: Help to classify images that are relevant to report about catastrophe's damages
twitter.modalSubTitle: We need your help to validate which images extracted automatically from posts in Social Media are actually giving useful information to emergency services.
twitter.tutorialLastStep: Click on help icon to display this tutorial again. Go for it! :)
twitter.tutorialExtracted: These are images extracted automatically from posts in Social Media.
twitter.tutorialNotRelevant: Examples of WHAT is NOT relevant
twitter.tutorialDisplayProblem: this section will display information of the post that contains the problem image.
twitter.noMoreTasks: There are no more available tasks for you. Thanks for your work!

translate.title: Translate from
translate.introTitle: Help to gather information of a catastrophe by translating words
translate.introSubTitle: The words you translate will be used to identify in Social Media #hashtags that people use to report catastrophe’s damages.
translate.last: Click on help icon to display this tutorial again. Go for it! :)
translate.tut01: Enable this if the translation is the name of the location.
translate.tut02: Add as many meanings of the word you know. Slang words typical of a region are especially useful.

optionlist.choose: Choose as many as you like

contact.title: Contact
contact.info: You can contact us via e-mail info@crowd4ems.org or join our Slack community. If you are interested in joining us in Slack, click in this link.

geolocation.highExtra: You found the exact location, meaning you locate a very accurate point on the map: building, street number, coordinates of a road or similar precision.
geolocation.mediumExtra: You know the image was taken close to your geolocation. It may be an street, road, path or similar.
geolocation.lowExtra: Meaning that the precision you have provided it’s in a level of a city, town, district, region, neighbour and so on.
geolocation.checkOriginalImage: Check the image's comments to validate it.
geolocation.checkOriginalVideo: Check the video's comments to validate it.
geolocation.checkToValidate: Check the image comment to validate it.
geolocation.checkOriginalLink: Check the video original link to read the comments.
geolocation.readTheFullPost: Read the full post. You can link to the source. Does the location provide a match?
geolocation.useGoogleImages: Use Google Images search and find relevant images to the current one.
geolocation.locateExactPosition: Locate the exact position of the damage.
geolocation.locateExactPositionDesktop: Locate the exact position of the damage on the map.
geolocation.useSearchbox: Use the search box or drag the flag to point the location.
geolocation.streetview2: on the map to find the precise location on the bigger map.
geolocation.streetview3: Use the second map as a way to know the overall location.
geolocation.streetview4: Visual clues on teh picture might help you: signs, landmarks, roadmarks, recognisable buildings, etc.
geolocation.streetview6: Drag and Drop the pin to place it in the exact position. When you are done with the location go to the next step.
geolocation.streetview7: Be as precise as you can.
geolocation.streetview2Desktop: on the map to find the precise location.
geolocation.streetview3Desktop: Visual clues on teh picture might help you: signs, landmarks, roadmarks, recognisable buildings, etc.
geolocation.streetview6Desktop: Be as precise as you can.
geolocation.greatPleaseMeasure: Great! Please, measure the precision of the location you've just saved
geolocation.modalTitle: Help us geolocate the images to its nearest precision.
geolocation.modalSubtitle: These images after geolocation will reflect on a Map used by professionals. Geo-locating to its nearest position will help in Rapid Disaster Assessment.
